A game with a good premise ruined by devs wanting to create a money mill. The devs keep adding more DLC and MTX to pad their pockets instead of focusing on game improvement. It almost seems like it is a victim of it's own success. There was a point where this game was reasonably fair and balanced but that is long gone now because every time you turn around they are adding another DLC to generate revenue before they even get the bugs ironed out of the last one.

To begin, the game is fun. You will have fun with it for the first hundred hours or so. After that you will begin to realize that you are just in a gameplay loop, farming for meta perks, with very jaded/salty/angsty other humans and some low rate twitch streamers who think they deserve special treatment. If you play survivor your friends will regularly throw you under the bus for their benefit or "funny stream content". After dealing with this long enough you will eventually become one of these people.

The game has an unfortunate focus around meta perks that will require hundreds of hours to obtain if you want to "git gud". Of course if you want to speed this process up you can always use your wallet to partake in any of the copious amounts of microtransactions and DLC present.

The game being inherently unbalanced has made it more unbalanced. As they say "the squeaky wheel gets the grease", and at any given time whichever side of the community is whining the loudest is the most overpowered. Currently it's the killer with many changes being made recently to tilt the scales in their favor. Add that to the many DLC killers who are just flat out broken already.

For a PC game, there are very limited graphics options and customization. You have 4 settings and a resolution scale. That's it. It's 2019 and we cannot set options for AA, AF filtering, etc etc in this game. If you modify the config files to tweak the game specifically to your tastes, you will be banned. The survivor FOV is so zoomed in now that all you can see is basically your character and maybe 1-2 feet beside them while the killer has perks that will widen their FOV to ludicrous levels. There are models in this game that look like they came straight from a PS2 title. Blocky, low polygon models everywhere. Most textures look muddy and washed out even on ultra. The lighting is pretty good but that's about it. For a game that's so behind the times graphically, it suffers from a lot of performance issues like stuttering, frame drops in certain areas, etc even on high end hardware. And you're locked to 60fps unless you modify game files, which can get you banned. "Deal with it."

The community as a whole is unbelievably toxic. People changing their steam names to things just to troll. Being extremely salty and spewing verbal diarrhea after every match, whether they win or lose. As a killer there is nothing you can do to prevent this, no matter how you play. There is a specific "way" you're supposed to play to appease the whiny survivors but despite your best efforts you will still get flamed 2/3 games. This extends into the survivors themselves as I stated previously. They will throw you under the bus at any opportunity. It's sad to think that these are your fellow humans that you walk the earth with.

Sadly this is the only game of it's kind right now so if you want a unique experience, this is your only option pretty much. There's Deathgarden but that game is a huge pile of sh!t made by the same devs. Hopefully something better will come along in time.

With the latest addition of a "battlepass" style system in a game that is not free-to-play I can no longer recommend this game at all. This type of predatory practice in video games is the sad state of the current industry and totally scummy. This game has turned into a money mill with loads of MTX, DLC, and now the battlepass system. They have made the grind extremely lengthy to encourage people to give them more money for no other reason than that they can. Sadly the balance, performance, and other issues that this game suffers will never be fixed as it solely exists now to get you to spend money on it. Time to move on.

This is the perfect game for me! I love survival horror games yet there neer seemed to be one where I can play with my friends. This is the perfect game to play with friends for countless hours! I can't wait to see what the future holds for this game! Hopefully a new update will come soon! Also, what if there was a killer like a werewolf or Bigfoot? That would be interesting! O.o
Best played with friends for maximum fun. There's a lot of fun killers to play as so you can find one that fits your style. Watch out for campers and trolls though. There's a lot of those.

Well, you know... like any game, this one has it's ups and downs. Many would say it's broken, which in their defense, it kinda is. But that's what makes it so different from other games. Sure, it's rage inducing at times because the devs may or may not overfix or they underfix things, but again, that's kind of what makes the game unique. 
This game will make you scream, cry, laugh and want to uninstall. It will make you question whether it was worth the buy, but all in all, it's cool. I dig it. Just don't take the matches too seriously. You will be digging your own grave if you do.
Good luck dudes <3

Dead by Daylight was and still is in my opinion one of the best multiplayer horror games. Even today, almost after two years I still enjoy the game a lot. The game does have it bugs so there is that to keep in mind but I think that with the new updates coming the game is definitively progressing forward.

Pro's:
-The Perk-system
-Its a lot of fun to play with friends, online or KYF(kill your friends)
-The amount of content: maps, customization, killers, and items make the game last a lot longer without getting boring, even if you only have the one objective.

Con's:
-Playing killer against organised survivors is frustrating. You cannot kill them without camping and/or tunneling unless you are very good at the game.
-Rank reset is problematic because when this happens, all the high ranking survivors and killers get in games with new players which isn't very fun for the new players.
-I'm a survivor main, but I have to admit that it is easy to let the killer chase you and keep him on you the entire match whilst the other survivors focus down the generators.

All in all, Dead by daylight is a great game to play with your friends and even solo. If you look past the bugs and sometimes toxic community this can really be a great game for you. Buy the game with a couple of friends and give it a shot, your going to enjoy it.

As I'm writing this review I have over 700 hours in the game. I used to love this game at one point. I've made many friends on this game and we've had some great times playing together. Dead By Daylight used to be a game that we could play for up to 12 hours at a time and never get tired of. That being said, this game has taken a turn for the worse. To put it simply, the toxicity is starting to mirror that of Friday the 13th. The power dynamic is all bugged. This game just isn't fun anymore. I waste hours of my time on this game and every time I get off I feel like I've gotten cancer from all the trolls and issues this game offers. It's simply not worth it. The devs don't care about the community and the community is too busy fighting with eachother to make this a fun gaming experience. Try Civilization. It'll probably be a better use of your time.

Do I absolutely love this game? Yes. Am I a survivor main? Yes. Do I think Killers need to get boosted? Absolutely. There are so many problems with it like the balancing issues (The killers have been nerfed to the point that all enjoyment in playing them has left and the survivors are over powered and there is no skill in playing them anymore.) Just from that issue I have been contemplating leaving the game till it was fixed, but the last straw for me is the banning of so many DBD youtubers for no reason. #unbanNo0b3 

The bugs can be debilitating (getting stuck in pallets or hooks) though they normally get fixed timely but the Devs won't listen to the player base to fix unfair killer issues and only listen to their casual player base, when they should be listening to the people who have a lot of hours poured into the game (I am not saying you should ignore them completely, just listen to both). The casuals can adapt and learn how to play against harder killers like in any other game, as DBD has a ranked system to try to get you in a game with people your level so you can learn. If the Devs don't start fixing the game so that it is fun for everyone they won't have a player base left.

Don't buy the game till it gets fixed, and don't play it until it gets fixed. Or play it but give back constructive criticism to make it better, it is truly a fun game overall. Mathieu Cote please fix your game.

Sincerely, a Survivor Main
Loads of fun with friends

Das Spiel hat, wie man bereits an meinen Spielstunden erahnen kann, einen sehr großen Suchtfaktor. Das liegt unter anderem daran, das fast alle 2 Wochen neuer Content hinzugefügt wird, aber auch an dem Levelsystem in dem Spiel, das viel Zeit in Anspruch nimmt. Aktuell macht das Spiel auch einen guten Eintrug, was das balancen der Survivor und Killer angeht.

Das einzige was mich noch aktuell bei dem Spiel stört sind, die Bugs, die nach jedem Update zurück kommen, die Toxic Community, die Startunfreundlichkeit für Anfänger oder die Lagswitcher/Cheater die in dem Spiel ihr unwesen treiben. Wobei bei diesen Punkten bereits aktuell nach einer Lösung gesucht wird.

Mein Fazit zu dem Spiel lautet: Gebt dem Spiel eine Chance und lasst euch nach ein paar schlechten Runden nicht unterkriegen. Mit der Zeit lernt man alles über das Spiel, was man wissen muss und hat den Spaß seines Lebens.

This game genuinely doesn't deserve it's popularity and playerbase numbers.
Despite it's huge public, it might be one of the literal worst games out there, for a Miriad of reasons, that are all product of it's design (choices).

The difficulty curve is like running head first into a brick wall.
As killer you rank pretty fast and end up going against meta perks you are ill equiped both exerience, or perk wise to deal with.

The balance of the killers, and perks (on either side) is absolute ass and a half, together with the maps.
It tips the favor of a party so much that the game becomes frustratingly hard.

Then there's the part that you get matched against people literally hundreds or THOUSANDS of hours better than you. The game not being balanced for multiple survivors (Meta communication breaks the game).
And everybody playing so ''optimally'' that it's kinda a  frustrating mess. Killers have to play shitty cause of meta perks, and meta perks are used cause killers have to play abusively.

When one side has fun, the other doesn't.

Then also: game runs poorly, even on better hardware, 5 years later.
And the controls are still clunky as all hell.

That this game hasn't died out for the quality and experience it provides, is astounding.
First in best dressed really helped them out.

Also, the weekends are even worse. You can turn cross platform off, but prepare for hard tunneling and camping killrs during the weekend, especially console players. And if you decide to play killer at night, guarantee you'll have to go against at least a 2 SFW, but mostly minimum 3. And ofcourse they'll have 800 - 1000 hours of experience more than you.

Game with terrible skewered gameplay balance.
Funnily enough to the SURVIVORS, who get an easy objective, and a ton of crutches if they make mistakes.
Only 3 -4 of a roster of 10 ish killers is viable and even then it relies more on the survivors to make mistakes than the killer being able to pressure them into most things.

Creative director thinks that if you have issues with the balance, you shoudl play another game, like CIV 5 (look it up, it happened).
All the while claiming: "We did a pretty good job so far"

The game is meagre, with little consideration for balance and with KILLERS that get BULLIED by SURVIVORS.
I joke you not.
